definitions.definition: ( metallurgy ) To shape a metal by heating and hammering .
To form or create with concerted effort.
examples: The politician's recent actions are an effort to forge a relationship with undecided voters.

definitions.definition: To create a forgery of; to make a counterfeit item of; to copy or imitate unlawfully .
examples: He had to forge his ex-wife's signature. The jury learned the documents had been forged .

definitions.definition: To make falsely; to produce, as that which is untrue or not genuine; to fabricate.

main_definition: ( metallurgy ) To shape a metal by heating and hammering .
secondary_definitions: To form or create with concerted effort.
To create a forgery of; to make a counterfeit item of; to copy or imitate unlawfully .
To make falsely; to produce, as that which is untrue or not genuine; to fabricate.

definitions.definition: To move forward heavily and slowly (originally as a ship); to advance gradually but steadily; to proceed towards a goal in the face of resistance or difficulty.
examples: The party of explorers forged through the thick underbrush.
We decided to forge ahead with our plans even though our biggest underwriter backed out.

definitions.definition: To advance , move or act with an abrupt increase in speed or energy.
examples: With seconds left in the race, the runner forged into first place.

main_definition: (often as forge ahead ) To move forward heavily and slowly (originally as a ship); to advance gradually but steadily; to proceed towards a goal in the face of resistance or difficulty.
secondary_definitions: (sometimes as forge ahead ) To advance , move or act with an abrupt increase in speed or energy.
